LevelSet Flow¶

First order derivative of the external force

Return type

np.array

flow(flow_type, function, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return the flow of the level set according to the type wanted

Parameters

  • flow_type –

    can be one of the following: - ‘constant’:

    \[C_t = N \Rightarrow \phi_t = |\nabla \varphi|\]

    • ’curvature’:

      \[C_t = kN \Rightarrow phi_t = div\left(\frac{\nabla \varphi}{|\nabla \varphi|}\right)|\nabla \varphi|\]

    • ’equi_affine’:

      \[C_t = k^{1/3} N \Rightarrow \phi_t = div\left(\frac{\nabla \varphi}{|\nabla \varphi|}\right)^{1/3}*|\nabla \varphi|\]

    • ’geodesic’: geodesic active contours, according to [CKS97]

      \[C_t = (g(I)k -\nabla(g(I))N)N \Rightarrow \phi_t = [g(I)\cdot div\left(\frac{\nabla \varphi}{|\nabla \varphi|}\right)^{1/3}*|\nabla \varphi|\]

    • ’band’: band velocity, according to [LKS06]

  • function – the level set according to which the flow goes (usually phi)

  • open_flag – boolean for open flag

Optionals

Parameters

  • gradientType – ‘L1’ L1 norm of grad(I); ‘L2’ L2-norm of grad(I); ‘LoG’ Laplacian of gaussian

  • sigma – sigma for LoG gradient

  • ksize – kernel size, for blurring and derivatives

  • regularization – regularization note for heaviside and dirac

Band velocity optionals

Parameters

  • band_width (int) – the width of the contour. default: 5

  • threshold (float) – for when the velocity equals zero. default: 0.5

  • stepsize (float) – default 0.05

Returns

phi_t

flow_types¶

Types of flow used to progress the curves

Default: {“geodesic”}

dict

init_phi(**kwargs)[source]¶

Builds an initial smooth function (Lipschitz continuous) that represents the interface as the set where phi(x,y,t) = 0 is the curve.

The function has the following characteristics:

\[\begin{split}\begin{cases} \phi(x,y,t) > 0 & \forall (x,y) \in \Omega \\ \phi(x,y,t) < 0 & \forall (x,y) \not\in \Omega \\ \phi(x,y,t) = 0 & \forall (x,y) \textrm{ on curve} \\ \end{cases}\end{split}\]

with \(\left| \nabla \phi \right| = 1\)

Characteristics of the function

Parameters

  • processing_props (dict) – properties for gradient and differentiation: - ‘gradientType’ - distance computation method - ‘sigma’ - for smoothing - ‘ksize’ - for smoothing

  • radius (int) – if the curve is a circle, the radius should be specified.

  • center_pt (tuple) – if the curve is a circle, the center point should be specified.

  • reularization_note – regularization note for heaviside function

  • function_type (str) – ‘circle’ (default); ‘vertical’ or ‘horizontal’ (for open contours)

init_psi(psi, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initializes the psi function (open edges)

Parameters

  • psi (nd-array mxn) – the function

  • processing_props – gradient process dictionary

moveLS(**kwargs)[source]¶

The function that moves the level set until the desired contour is reached

Parameters

- flow types and their weight (string, weight) (flow_type) –

‘constant’, ‘curvature’, ‘equi-affine’, ‘geodesic’, ‘chan-vese’, ‘band’

Note

The ‘chan-vese’ flow requires weights (chanvese_w), for the four components of the model:

{area_w, length_w, inside_w, outside_w}
Parameters

  • gvf_flag – flag to add gradient vector flow

  • open_flag – flag for open contours

  • mumford_shah – flag for mumford_shah flow

  • scaleX (float) – enhance X direction

  • scaleY (float) – enhance Y direction

:return the contours after level set

mumfordshah_flow(img=True, nu=1)[source]¶

Computes the Mumford-Shah flow for a multi-phase level set, according to [VC02].

set_flow_types(**kwargs)[source]¶

Set the flow types and their weights according to which the level set will move

Options are as in flow()

For example:

set_flow_types(geodesic=1., curvature=.2, equi_affine: 0.5})
set_weights(**kwargs)[source]¶

Set weights for constraints.

Parameters

  • gvf_w (float) – gradient vector flow weight

  • vo_w (float) – open contour weight (Not working at the moment)

  • region_w (float) – region constraint weight
